result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shakoora Louise Ward

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shakoora Louise Ward in court.  Attorney John c Glover in court for Shakoora Louise Ward.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-21-2022

Defendant Shakoora Louise Ward in court.  Attorney John c Glover in court for Shakoora Louise Ward.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 08-29-2022

Defendant Shakoora Louise Ward in court with attorney John c Glover.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Shakoora Louise Ward appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield PD Officer T. O'Brien. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 08-16-2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid license.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shakoora Louise Ward in court with attorney Katherine Elizabeth Holloway.  Defendant Shakoora Louise Ward in custody.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shakoora Louise Ward appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
